III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employment policies and procedures; establishment.
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally
stable and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education
to perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 sexually abused Youth A during past placements at
the facility.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 03/07/2025
during a scheduled child advocacy center interview. During this
interview Youth A did not recall making any statements about the
alleged abuse she suffered from Supervisor 1 during a previous
stay at the facility. Youth A did not know who Supervisor 1 was
and repeatedly could not recall making the allegations at the time
of her recent placement at the facility. Youth A recalled being
intoxicated at the time that this statement was made.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 03/18/2025. She denied ever sexually abusing Youth
A. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A’s previous placements in the
facility and stated her only interaction with Youth A was through
the day treatment programming offered by the facility. Supervisor
1 believed she had never been alone with Youth A. Supervisor 1
recalled Youth A stating a similar allegation against another staff
in previous years and that had been investigated with no
concerns. She recalled taking precautions interacting with Youth
A at that time, making efforts to never be alone with her and
attempting to be with her in areas with security camera
coverage. Supervisor 1 stated not having any contact with Youth
A since the most recent placement at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 03/19/2025. She
recalled being with Youth A at the time of her most recent
placement at the facility and hearing Youth A make the initial
allegation that she had been sexually abused by Supervisor 1 in
the past. Staff 1 recalled Youth A being intoxicated and admitting
to drinking alcohol prior to the placement. At that time Youth A
was slurring her words and many of her statements were not
making sense, according to Staff 1. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
2

stating that she had been sexually abused by multiple people in
her past, including Supervisor 1. This statement did not contain
any other details and did not fit the context of any other
conversation occurring as Youth A entered the placement.
During a video conference held on 04/11/2025 DHHS Worker 1
provided an update on her investigation. DHHS Worker 1 stated
having recent contact again with Youth A, interviewing her over
the phone. DHHS Worker 1 reported Youth A denied Supervisor
1 had ever sexually abused her during this phone interview.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation from the facility dated
03/04/2025 was provided and reviewed. This
documentation provided an account of Youth A’s placement
at the facility and statement about alleged sexual abuse of
Youth A by Supervisor 1 and was consistent with interviews
provided.
• Personnel file for Supervisor 1 was provided. She had no
instances of discipline during her employment at the facility.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed Youth A and Supervisor 1
denied Supervisor 1 sexually abused Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
